text: 2 + 2 equals 4.
false: 2 + 2 equals 5.

text: The square root of 144 is 12.
false: The square root of 144 is 14.

text: 7 multiplied by 8 equals 56.
false: 7 multiplied by 8 equals 54.

text: The sum of angles in a triangle is 180 degrees.
false: The sum of angles in a triangle is 360 degrees.

text: An even number plus an even number is always even.
false: An even number plus an even number is always odd.

text: Zero is neither positive nor negative.
false: Zero is a positive number.

text: The product of any number and zero is zero.
false: The product of any number and zero is that number.

text: Pi is an irrational number.
false: Pi equals exactly 22 divided by 7.

text: There are infinitely many prime numbers.
false: There is a largest prime number.

text: 0.999 repeating equals exactly 1.
false: 0.999 repeating is strictly less than 1.

text: Correlation does not imply causation.
false: If two variables are correlated, one must cause the other.

text: The probability of heads on a fair coin is 0.5 regardless of previous flips.
false: After 10 heads in a row, tails becomes more likely on the next flip.

text: Division by zero is undefined.
false: Any number divided by zero equals infinity.

text: The empty set is a subset of every set.
false: The empty set is not a subset of any set.

text: A square is always a rectangle.
false: A square is never a rectangle because squares and rectangles are different shapes.

text: If all cats are animals and Fluffy is a cat, then Fluffy is an animal.
false: If all cats are animals and Fluffy is an animal, then Fluffy must be a cat.

text: The contrapositive of a true conditional statement is also true.
false: The converse of a true conditional statement is always true.

text: A number raised to the power of zero equals one, for any nonzero base.
false: A number raised to the power of zero always equals zero.

text: Negative times negative gives a positive result.
false: Negative times negative gives a negative result.

text: The Monty Hall problem: switching doors gives a 2/3 chance of winning.
false: The Monty Hall problem: switching or staying gives an equal 50/50 chance.

text: In base 2, the number 10 represents the decimal value 2.
false: In base 2, the number 10 represents the decimal value 10.

text: The factorial of 0 is defined as 1.
false: The factorial of 0 is 0.

text: An odd number plus an odd number is always even.
false: An odd number plus an odd number is always odd.

text: The sum of the first 10 positive integers is 55.
false: The sum of the first 10 positive integers is 50.

text: A valid argument can have a false conclusion if a premise is false.
false: A valid logical argument always has a true conclusion.

text: The birthday paradox: with 23 people, there is a greater than 50% chance two share a birthday.
false: You need at least 183 people for a 50% chance that two share a birthday.

text: Infinity is not a number; it is a concept describing unboundedness.
false: Infinity is the largest number.

text: The derivative of a constant is zero.
false: The derivative of a constant is the constant itself.

text: Parallel lines never intersect in Euclidean geometry.
false: Parallel lines eventually meet at infinity in Euclidean geometry.

text: The base-10 logarithm of 1000 is 3.
false: The base-10 logarithm of 1000 is 30.

text: A tautology is a statement that is true in every possible interpretation.
false: A tautology is a statement that is sometimes true and sometimes false.

text: The commutative property means a + b = b + a.
false: The commutative property means a + b = a times b.

text: In probability, P(A or B) = P(A) + P(B) - P(A and B) for any events.
false: P(A or B) = P(A) + P(B) for any events A and B.

text: The Pythagorean theorem states that a-squared plus b-squared equals c-squared for right triangles.
false: The Pythagorean theorem states that a plus b equals c for all triangles.

text: Absolute value of negative 5 is 5.
false: Absolute value of negative 5 is negative 5.

text: The mean of a dataset can be affected by outliers.
false: The mean of a dataset is never affected by outliers.

text: A prime number has exactly two distinct factors: 1 and itself.
false: 1 is a prime number because its only factor is itself.

text: The order of matrix multiplication matters: AB is not generally equal to BA.
false: Matrix multiplication is commutative, so AB always equals BA.

text: Simpson's paradox shows that a trend in data can reverse when groups are combined.
false: Combining separate datasets always preserves the trends seen in each group.

text: An irrational number cannot be expressed as a ratio of two integers.
false: Every number can be expressed as a ratio of two integers.
